column4: can anyone help with a failed installation? how do i continue it?
what's wrong with the installation. There has to be a reason why it failed.. if there isn't then we can't help you.

I have just installed Ubuntu5.10 (i386), after the reboot the install screen installed/confgured further packages and then displayed "There was a problem installing the selected software...". after an erroneous keystroke I was thrown to the console I have the last msg from all consoles but then did a C-M-Del. The reboot went through the graphical startup and dumped me into the console (login). Any suggestions on how to finish the
installation?
you might have hardware incompatablities.
unlikely, live cd works, knoppix worx
well try installing knoppix or gentoo off knoppix maybe that'll work.. If it does, then you have a messed up CD.
how would i continue an install
as I said, you probably have a currupted CD if it isn't your hardware, did you download off slow net?
yep, i'll do an MD5 check -- however, it's a torrent so it should check itself :-/
well if your net was slow it'll probably be that. Why didn't you just get a regular iso? instead of the torrent..
it is an iso. i simply shared it in a torrent and compared against others.
ahh right.
sorry, wan't explaining well
I wouldn't know then. :( You should ask a few others, or download straight from the site.
maybe the link you acquired ubuntu from wasn't really authenticated. There are a whole lot of problems. Just try again.
in any case -- if the install would hang, i then choose to reboot, and want to continue the install -- how would i do this?
or would it do it automagically?
you'd have to start from the beggining. You can't quit an install and hope for it to continue after a reboot.
i see, ubuntu doesnt keep a log of where it last was and continues from there in case of a freeze (esp, during hardwrae detectiion)
i'll do a MD5 check and try again. thanks for your help
anytime.
